text:
Erythema multiforme major in a 2-month-old child with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.
 A case is presented of severe erythema multiforme occurring in a 2-month-old boy from Zimbabwe which was probably triggered by phenobarbitone.
 He later developed the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome and serological tests suggested that it was a congenital HIV-I infection.
